summary: Popular cartoon characters Rocky and Bullwinkle make their big-screen debut in this adventure tale that combines animation with live action. Years after their television show was canceled, Rocky and Bullwinkle are still living off the residuals. This time, when three cartoon villains enter the real world as real people, they decide to take over the United States.

reviews.content: I will defend this movie till I die

This film is a lot worse than I remember. It captures what was great about the original and has the exact same kind of tone and sense of humor. It is hilarious at times, but overall the script sucks and the cgi is awful. I do however commend them on getting a huge wealth of stars to be in this film. It's really suprising. I still really enjoy this film despite how bad it is. In my opinion it's so bad it's good and definitely worth seeing at least once.
LOL, the funniest 01 hour: and 28 minutes ever!!!!!!!!!!!!! Starring Jason Alexander as Boris!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

À frente do tempo, um filme infantil Mas não tão infantil assim,falando sobre poder que a televisão exerce sobre a mente humana, principalmente na eleição do presidente, isso lá no ano 2000, muito atual por sinal, responsabilidade social e proteção ambiental, criança fofas espertas, vilões caricatos, bonitinho...
This is from my childhood, and clearly a great family flick for me and my mom to enjoy.

I just saw this the other night.  Not too much earlier, I had watch War of the Worlds and been fairly underwhelmed by the lack of heroism in the Tom Cruise character Ray, and was a bit weary of that type of movie.  So I was ready for something different and chose The Adventures of Rocky and Bullwinkle.  I was a bit leery given the 20% audience rating, but I had liked the cartoon as a kid and decided I needed to see this movie.  Robert De Niro, Jason Alexander, and Rene Russo did a great job as the villains, and even mimicked the cartoon characters very well when they were jumping up and down in frustration.  Very good acting.  The original Rocky and Bullwinkle show I watched was a pretty low quality cartoon, but it was still funny and it pass the time on Sunday mornings before church.  This movie is similarly of a lower quality special effects-wise when compared to other movies out there, but it was still entertaining and that lack of sophistication seems to fit the movie extending the cartoon series.  I wouldn't say this movie is a continuous laugh riot like a lot of Leslie Nielson movies tend to be, but it was still fairly entertaining.  Nothing too inappropriate for younger viewers (not that I can recall anyways), and some decent plot device twists I didn't see coming.  20% seems really harsh for this movie.  It deserves a better rating.  It did make me laugh out loud a few times.  Its societal commentary was dead on.

Another relic from the "let's make a live-action movie from an old cartoon" fad from decades ago. Better than most of the others, but it still doesn't work, even with the decision to keep Rocky and Bullwinkle as toons rather than use, say, people in animal costumes.

A full-fledged cartoon version would have been far better. The human actors don't fit in with their cartoon counterparts. Robert DeNiro certainly didn't fit the part of Fearless Leader (they should have given that role to Nicholas Cage, who had a more suitable physique). We could have done without "Nothing But A Dreamer" by Supertramp either (the cartoon didn't have music, other than the theme and some "dramatic effect" chords at times) This effectively spoiled the old cartoon atmosphere, and the story itself was meandering and ultimately boring and pointless. For the running time, they could have done so much more.

Intended for fans of the old cartoon, but probably won't satisfy most of them.
Another movie that does not live up to its potential!!

While this movie has some good points, it's not good enough to save the film. It blows big time. I only saw it once in the theatre but I don't want to see it again. I guess it's supposed to be a comedy but I rarely found it funny. The were quotes in the ads I hoped to see in the movie but got disappointed. The animation is a mix of good cartoon to bad live action cgi. In my humble opinion, it's not worth watching so avoid it if you can.

your  not seeing things, your not me, the one who watched The review the one who thought this be absoulty garbage, the one i said would never see this, really really enjoyed this movie, i laugh a few times, i smiled at the end, this movie is 10 stars 10, that's how good it is, everyone please see it my rating for this movie is 10/10 stars,

Saw this in theaters as a kid.  Memory based rating.

Three decades to come up with a Rocky and Bullwinkle movie and they give us a flying squirrel who can't fly in a movie that doesn't fly. It seeme the writers were trying to make fun of Rocky and Bullwinkle rather than make Rocky and Bullwinkle fun. What's next, a Superman movie where he's stuck on a planet with a red sun?
Even though it's crap in every way, you have to see it. It's so bad it's freaking fantastic.
46% "Not only the animation was fully rendered, the film becomes unofficial if they had to sit through a crap ton of previews".
As a huge fan of the series I liked it. Not love, but liked it
classic movie when i was a kid when it came out on the vhs
This movie was pretty decent with the 2d animation but it can get boring sometimes
I liked it as a kid but can't get into it. Feel sorry for making my parents watch it.
The film swings wildly from hit to miss in its screenplay, but as a send-off to its source material, it's rather respectable and its wild nature works as special length episode of the titular series.
It's filled with tons of puns, some painful but the CGI animation holds up nearly 20 years later and can fall into the category of so bad it is good. I love the humor and cheese factor it brings.

I gave this movie 2 stars it was alright based on the 60's cartoon Rocky and Bullwinkle which I liked as a kid. Nostalgic comedy kinda corny but passes the time this movie was kind of a flop according to the reviews, mixed reviews. I remember hearing somewhere that Robert DeNiro hated doing this movie it had well known actors in it alright nothing to really write home about in my opinion, but watchable.
Corny, awkward, yet brilliant. Just like the old TV show.
Childhood CLASSIC! The film is brilliant, even if it is a tad bit naff. Nothing quite compares to the hilarious and engaging Adventures of Rocky and Bullwinkle.

The Adventures of Rocky & Bullwinkle is disappointing. Not because I thought it remarkably awful but rather because it was actually quite funny and I found myself wondering "where's all the crappiness I can make fun of?" True, some of the live-action performances could've used a little work and the script isn't fantastic with odd-looking computer animation for the titular characters but given the nature of the movies from the Alvin and the Chipmunks era, this cartoon adaptation is only funny depending on how familiar you are with the original cartoon. It's very silly but the jokes work and actually do sound like they belong in the original TV show, making this more than just a special episode of the TV show in a new medium and with higher production values. Brush up on your R&B cartoons and watch this movie again. You might actually have a good time.

It matches the source material beautifully, maybe a little too well. There are plenty of good jokes to keep you laughing to help make up for its terrible plot. It also has bad performances, terrible effects, and an absurd amount of annoying cameos. Its nowhere near the worst thing ever. However, it was doomed from the minute it decided to use live action.
This film was unwatchable.
I actually found this half decent because I liked the humor and that it tried staying true to the cartoon, even though the story could use some work.

The movie was great; a much more faithful modern adaptation of Rocky & Bullwinkle than others I've seen. It wasn't perfect, but it was enjoyable nonetheless. The celebrity cameos were also poignant, particularly Kenan & Kel.
The only good live action cartoon adaptation
A surprisingly subversive film in parts.
This is a funny comedy movie!

While most of the celeb cameos don't work (except John Goodman), this film is still surprisingly faithful to the original television show. It's pretty well cast: Piper Perabo, Randy Quaid, Jason Alexander, and Rene Russo are all great (and even Robert De Niro has his moments). June Foray returns to voice her classic role of Rocky and is a delight as always, Keith Scott steps in for the late Bill Scott (no relation) to voice Bullwinkle and is just as great. The film is maybe a little too long, but it's perfectly enjoyable, innocent, and sweet. Expect giggles and guffaws. Fans of the original show should be pleased.

I liked this movie alot . Look was it great no but I'm a big Rocky and Bullwinkle fan so maybe thats why I liked it so much. The movie had tons of stars in the movie  plus Bullwinkle was a fool like he always is. Some way some how they need to either need to reboot the show or give us another movie we the fans deserve it
If you like the original show then you'll probably enjoy this
The beginning is super promising, and it is very faithful to the cartoon! But then, the live-action starts... ugh.
I saw it at the Driven Movie theater in Lake George, it stinked.
A surprisingly good adaptation.
I actually loved this movie (both as a child and later as an adult). Anyone expecting a serious film will be let down but if you are in for a fun ride, this movie is for you.
It wasn't gold, but at least I was entertained.

I agree with the Rotten Tomatoes review on this one totally. I think it does stay true to the spirit and nature of the classic cartoon when it cuts to the titular characters, it's just that some of the puns are annoying, the script is a bit of a letdown, and while the animation works fine with the live action, the CG doesn't look all that convincing.
Could of been worse...but not much.

Although it has a charm, this Rocky and Bullwinkle adventure is forgettable, unfunny, and badly acted, making it a disappointing take on the original cartoon that could have been a lot better if its CG-i didn't age badly.
I thought it was a pretty decent flick. It made me laugh. Loved Piper Perabo. She looks like an older ChloÃ« Grace Moretz.

As a fan of the original Rocky & Bullwinkle cartoon- you want this to be good. Unfortunately, the nostalgic glow wears off fairly quickly. Lots of puns as well as knocks at Hollywood- but not enough to get a laugh out loud. Wish it was better. Good cast though for the parts. Rating: 5/10
It's cringe inducing having to watch DeNiro act like that. I almost want to apologize to him.
The cartoon is funny and inventive something these filmakers didn't have in this movie.
The Adventures of Rocky and Bullwinkle is one of the best bad movies ever made. It's stupid, I know, but it makes me laugh. Plus there's no denying that it will charm you.
It's stupid, but decently funny at the same time.
With rather unconvincing CGI and too many fourth wall jokes to handle, Rocky and Bullwinkle doesn't achieve what the original did.
Annoying, often boring and mostly lacking in humour. Full review later.

For the first five minutes this is an entertaining cartoon. Then it goes live action, and the wheels come off. There are some good chuckles here and there, but far too many groan-worthy puns. The cast mugs for the camera every chance they get. It reeks of desperation.
Dumb reboot cgi movie of the iconic rocky and bullwinkle.

The first 3/4 of the movie was pretty great. I love how hilariously they make fun of themselves and even parody life and cartoons. There were times I laughed out of sheer irony. 
This is one of those sort-of all-stars movies with some random major actors but not a whole lot. I wouldn't give it 5 stars because I can't forgive a sappy, silly ending, even if it is on purpose. Also, I can understand the low official rating, but it seems a bit harsh.

I actually think this is a movie that Universal should be proud of even though it doesn't seem to be getting the appreciation it deserves. It's a very funny family feature with heart. Rocky and Bullwinkle are such an odd yet lovable pair. (First and only full viewing - 12/13/2014)

I barely remember anything from the film when I was young. The things that I remember are the main characters, and the computer scene. Saying those are not a good sign before I watch it again. The movie, sadly, is terrible. The jokes are really bad and it ruined the movie. However, the acting is the only thing that's trying to be funny in this and actually gets a laugh here and there in the film. The effects are really good and it fits with it, but it is the script that ruins the film. The Adventures of Rocky and Bullwinkle is disappointing and can actually be a good film, but misses the chance.

I think this is an EXCELLENT ......
and very funny movie! This is just like the original cartoon! Well....they had to update the Rocky and Bullwinkle caricature some.
This was my ALL Favorite Cartoon and my Favorite Movie of the year 20000! It is 100% FUN!

People need to realize that the original cartoon was just as campy and punny as the movie depicts, but the campiness and puns, in addition to clever writing, are what made the original such a classic. That being said, this film is by no means a classic (Robert De Niro's most shocking (no pun intended) role since Mary Shelley's Frankenstein), but it's one of the better cartoon adaptations I've seen, and certainly better than the other Jay Ward adaptations that preceded it. It's definitely a recommendation for Rocky and Bullwinkle fans, and classic cartoon fans in general, but may have people not familiar with the show rolling their eyes. Bottom line is that it's one of those films that are "so bad it's good."

It was a very funny, pretty enjoyable and very entertaining live action/animated family comedy adventure. It had great CGI animation, great traditional animation, great cast, very fun cameos, plenty of laughs, great adventure, great characters, great cinematography, very colorful backgrounds, great music and a fun storyline. I remembered when I saw this movie at the movie theater from my summer camp when I was 8 years old. Bullwinkle fans of all ages should enjoy this movie.

Lo intentaron. Realmente lo intentaron.  Pero esta cinta no le llega ni a los pies al espectacular dibujo animado para televisión de Jay Ward sobre una Ardilla superhéroe, su alce asistente y los espías villanos.  Robert DeNiro, quien co-produjo la cinta y quien interpreta a Fearless líder, imita a Travis Bickle en "Taxi Driver" y genera pena ajena.

We are the most terrifying villains in the history of children's television.

Rocky, Bullwinkle, and all of their friends, and villains, have been stuck in reruns for over 30 years on public television.   Boris, Natasha, and their Fearless Leader find a way to warp into real life.  The government decides to give the case to one of their weakest officers, who is assigned Rocky and Bullwinkle to stop the notorious villains.  Can Rocky and Bullwinkle be as successful in real life as they are in the cartoons?

"I assume you're both computer literate."

Des McAnuff, director of The Tempest, 700 Sundays, Cousin Bette, and Caesar and Cleopatra, delivers The Adventures of Rocky and Bullwinkle.  The storyline for this picture actually reminded me of Rat Race with two cartoons added to the cast.  The plot was nothing special and the animation was okay.  The make-up was pretty good but the acting was below par.  The cast includes Robert De Niro, Jason Alexander, Renee Russo, Randy Quaid, Piper Perabo, John Goodman, David Alan Grier, Doug Jones, Billy Crystal, and Whoopi Goldberg.  

"You weigh 400 imaginary pounds."
"But it's all moosle."

My daughter and I watched this movie this morning and when I first put it on she said, "that's daddy's movie."  I finally convinced her this movie was for her, and as soon as the movie started, she was hooked.  She loved every second of this film, from beginning to end.  I can't say this was a good movie, it was definitely below par, but you may be surprised to discover kids love it (mine sure did)!

"Quick, let's go to commercial."

Grade: C-
moose n squirrel rule
Really funny and underrated

Blast from the past if there ever was one and surprisingly not tainted by growing up, it's just how I remembered it and a little bit more, I get some of the jokes that were meant for older audiences because I was about 10 at the time and that was when I used to copy this movie constantly. It was an all around great funny time, I liked it. 19% by audiences? Really? The critics score is surprisingly high. I liked the story and the amount of in jokes they make, it's supposed to be silly and the movie just relishes in that, 4th wall breaking galore. Robert De Niro was a lot of fun and clearly had a blast in the role and he even produced the darn thing! Just for sheer enjoyment and nostalgia I'd give it a five but I need to not be biased.
I honestly 'hate' this movie. It's nothing like the animated series.

This movie seems almost conflicted at points with its characters and what points they go. Everything on the DVD complimenting it is a big lie, really, but I'm sure kids will enjoy it, the adults will be in cinematic hell.
Rocky and Bullwinkle try to make their big comeback (which ultimately failed) in this new-age spin on the old cartoon. Rocky and Bullwinkle come to life in CGI form while their villains, Fearless Leader and his henchmen Boris and Natasha, are plotting to brainwash the nation by taking over every TV channel and replacing their show with corny German sitcoms. Rocky and Bullwinkle and their insanely unlikable FBI friend Agent Sympathy try to stop them by going on a road trip to NYC.
This movie fails in everything it does, but I gave it a 1 1/2 rating because it may be appealing to kids, despite how bland the feel of it is. The jokes fall flat because they have that wacky feel to them, but it just doesn't work here. Rocky and Bullwinkle themselves are incredibly bland as characters. Rocky is basically the voice of reason but nothing else other than that. Bullwinkle is just a poor man's Goofy, while the villains Boris and Natasha aren't as bad as our main stars, but still are incredibly unfunny. De Niro was only in like 15 minutes of the film and seemed very uncaring towards his role. I can see why after seeing this trash. I would not suggest it even to kids, because while it says "HIP!" on the DVD box, it's just saying that it has 2 minute guest stars from the present age like Kenan & Kel and Billy Crystal, so now it's somehow "hip". It's a bland-fest.
It's a decent homage to the original cartoon, but I do wish they had done more with it than they did.
A very shameful display.

Its not that bad but the jokes run dry though. De Niro and Alexander are great in the cartoonish roles and to be honest I couldn't even tell it was him. Piper's performance is godawful and Rene Russo isn't that bad though she was panned by critics. A good funny film nothing special
This was surreal, seeing cartoon characters in real life
It feels much like the old cartoon, but the screenplay is abysmal.

It can be funny at times, though it takes a couple viewings to pick up on all the jokes (and not in a good way). The cast is mostly good (clearly having fun in their roles), as is the special effects. The movie doesn't take itself too seriously, and knows it's not anything good. It's not nearly as witty or funny as the cartoon, but I still found it enjoyable nonetheless. It's memorable, and I do have some nostalgia for it.
Poisoning the '50s/'60s...
Maybe if the film was pure cartoon, not a cartoon live action hybrid. It's strange to have cartoon characters running around in the real world. (Ahem, Smurfs? )

Not even Robert De Niro can save this horribly written, poorly executed film.  I give the production props for attempting to stay faithful to the look and feel of the original show, but the execution is lackluster and the jokes unfunny.  Of all the saturday morning cartoon re-imaginings that came out of this unfortunate period of cinema, "The Adventures of Rocky & Bullwinkle" is arguably the very worst.
Pretty silly, punny, and goofy, but not unwatchable (especially if you've ever seen the original cartoons).  The villains steal it, though, particularly Boris and Natasha's actors.
Just pass on this Film.
An embarrassment to one of the only things I truly love.

Maybe I'd rather see Dave Coulier doing his Bullwinkle routine than this again. Rocky and Bullwinkle aren't terrible and I like the original cartoons but this movie is a mess. The only thing that works is DeNiro and he is border lining badness.
For any of those who grew up watching this show, will get a kick out of this film. New viewers(after the cancellation of the syndication)will love it too. Great for kids under the age of 13.

So...Rocky and Bullwinkle come to life...now I will say the production company should have left these historical characters alone, because all they did was create a complete disaster! 

This movie gets yet a nod to the 'Disgrace Of Historic Toon Characters' hall of fame trophy; I hope they take it with a high degree. This is yet another film where Hollywood decides to make a mockery of fine cartoon characters, to cash in on a project that was surely abolished by all means. Keep the cartoon series in your hearts if you loved Rocky And Bullwinkle...stay away from this crap.

WOW THIS WAS ONE OF THE DUMBEST HORRIBLE MOVIES I HAVE EVER SEEN AND A REALLY PAINFULL EXPERIENCE THROUGHOUT!!!!!!!!!! EVERYTHING ABOUT THIS IS JUST WRONG ON SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO MANY LEVELS!!!!!!!!!! I WILL DESPISE THIS CRAP TO MY DYING DAY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
As bad as it seems it would be. And it would seem to be terrible.
This is why 9/11 happened the following year.

Okay, this movie's not god, but I don't think it was meant to be good to begin with. Just like the show, it's full of bad puns and self-referential humor. I give it credit for trying to be true to it's original cartoon unlike most movies based on cartoons that do it differently. I kinda like it, but I hardly watch it.

I feel this movie deserves more recognition, because it has preformances by actors that would never believe could pull off this movie. I personally like this movie it was Fresh, whitty had good planned jokes, and the story is funny, has no annoying moments, plus the characters a great. i would love to watch this over again
I loved Rocky & Bullwinkle as a kid.   While there were definitely funny moments, the movie left me wondering if I still would enjoy the cartoon.
Standard film, mediocre, nothing further, worth one watch or two.
Annoying narrator and some unfunny and predictable gags make this movie either worth skipping or open for repair in the future.
It's got the hot chick from 'Coyote Ugly' in it.  That's about it.
All this movie makes the viewer want to do is watch the classic cartoons, and avoid this movie at all costs.
THIS. THIS IS BAD. SOOO BAD. IT DIDN'T DESERVE TWO BLOODY STARS IT GOT ON TELEVISION.

very funny film. robert deniro, rene russo and jason alexander are very good as the villians in this comedy/animated caper based on the T.V. show from the 60's. some of the storyline is a bit cliche and boring to the mind, but other than that and some of the acting (lol) this not a bad movie.
MOUSE AND SQUIRREL ARE BACK PS where is boom

Sort of a good concept of bringing the famous moose and squirrel duo into our world with matching voice talents, but pretty much of this family film is annoying and the non-stop talking narrator is pretty much the cause of that. He just won't shut up. (C+)
Who asked for this movie?
it's self referential humor in the worst possible way

Silly but actually quite funny, it's better than most of the live action animations like Alvin and the Chipmunks for example. The director actually tried very hard on making this film work, so did the script writer. If only the dumb slapsticks were removed, this would be quite a good film to watch

It's silly, but funny if you like Rocky and Bullwinkle.
Not a very good movie, but any movie made for this purpose was sure not to be a good one. It is fairly entertaining though.

differed from the cartoons to much
It's bad... but still
Pretty good live action/cartoon movie from the original series.
Pues aunque sea infantil y muy tonta a ratos, "The Adventures of Rocky & Bullwinkle" brinda un sano y divertido entretenimiento familiar.
was ok but cartoon was so much better
Movies that use cartoons and real people never ever work.
i love this movie i used to watch with my dad.
Quite fun at times, courtesy Bullwinkle's dialogue, the joke wears thin by the time the credits have rolled but, overall, isn't a bad adaptation of the popular cartoon show.
Obviously made for kids, but caters to it's fan well and is entertaining enough for the whole family to enjoy.

When you get up to the scene when the Fearless Leader talks about not having received complaints from the "vegetables", you'll understand the reason this movie is just not cutting it in terms of humor. Especially for those lovers of Spitting image and the Maggie Thatcher joke that made the concept of "vegetables" popular...
Its a Guilty Pleasure to me because Piper Perabo is in it , Im a huge Piper fan shes a real talented actress
Eh, it's definitely no George of the Jungle. Maybe I'm just biased though.

So very bad...the cartoon was way better.  It might be enjoyable for very young kids though.  Piper Perabo does alright though, well...as all right as she could have considering the script she had to work with.
it is a wonderful movie. I enjoyed it very much.
If you found the humor of the cartoon funny you will like this movie which is funny and totally self aware of how downright silly it is

I watched yet another silly movie, it was not as good as Who Framed Roger Rabbit but it was filled with cameos.  I know how some actors want to include kids movies in their portfolio but De Niro playing the leader come on.  He is too good for this movie.  But this movie did give Piper Perabo a jump start for her career.  I wouldn't waste any time with this movie.
there is nothing good about this film. Even bullwinkle's dialogue is sub-par
Stupid but has decent parts
2/10 goes to Billy Crystal's cameo appearance. That's all.

"...and RBTV changed it's name from Really Bad Television to Rocky & Bullwinkle Television."

"What's the difference?"

Absolutely nothing. How did they get DeNiro to do this pile of crap?
Watching w the kids. Omg horrible. Why why why
stupid, but noting I wanted to slit my wrist over
It could've been a lot worse. I'm looking at you, Dudley Do-Right

Call me crazy, but I like the Rocky and Bullwinkle movie.  If you judge these adaptations purely by how true they stay to their source then I have to say this one is a success.  This is really all Rocky and Bullwinkle ever was...puns, silly adventures, cheesy jokes, bad jokes, and bumbling villains.  The film is just as fun as the show was.  Still I easily admit the show is better, but the movie is a nice little companion to the show really.
It has good points, but this is a movie that should never have been made.

Not the worst cartoon to live action adaptation but still pretty bad. The script is basically a hurricane of cheeky 4th wall jokes and puns. Perhaps the only real entertainment (and this is a stretch) are performances by Jason Alexander and Robert DeNiro so full of ham and cheese that they could supply a whole planet of delicatessens between the two of them. The rest of the cast is pretty listless and the humor mostly falls flat. Not unbearably terrible but fairly close.

Stupidly amazing and amazingly stupid; a breathtaking, high-concept, throw-shit-at-the-wall-&-see-what-sticks adventure. Watch in amazement as each new volley of shameless puns suddenly shoots up, peaks, and descends ominously toward you! Honestly, it's all pretty exciting. The villain parts might be a bit hard to stomach (it's tough to see Robert De Niro prancing around like a numbskull, even when he's doing it joyfully), but the actual Rocky-and-Bullwinkle parts are awesome, mostly thanks to Rocky's indefatigable straight-man routine and hilarious faux-innocent voice.

This is a great movie, very light-hearted and funny. 

The one thing I do hate about it is De Niro. What possessed them to put him in a kids movie?

Other than that, great movie.

I thought this film was crap and I will not want to watch it again, I didn't like this film, I expected better than that, it starred Randy Quaid (Dennis Quaid's older brother), Robert De Niro, Rene Russo and John Goodman
were the filmmakers high when they were making this film?
Not "Roger Rabbit," but still entertaining.
a fun and enjoyable heck of a time. there is non stop fun and humor in this faithful film adaption that even spoof it's own origin! A

cute jolly kid flick.

The Adventures of Rocky and Bullwinkle may look like another worthless cartoon adaptation but it sticks to its roots and gives all that it has. Thanks to a good cast of actors, not only are the cartoon characters supported but it also makes its cheery screenplay work well too. 

For my full review of The Adventures of Rocky and Bullwinkle (2000), check it out on this IMDB link: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0131704/reviews-203
Holds up well to the campyness of the original. Terrible digital animation, but good fun for fans of the original.
one of the nostalgic films of my past
they really didnt have to make this movie did they
I enjoyed this movie when I was a kid! I remember watching Rocky and Bullwinkle a lot
I'm a sucker for pun humor and Hollywood insider movies, so when you combine the two, I'm going to be hard-pressed not to enjoy it.

Rocky and Bullwinkle isn't the funniest cartoon made into a movie. Niether is it a great movie. It is however, pretty true to the source material, and had some great acting from upcoming piper Perabo(Who is ellegant both in this film, and in real life.)

This film honestly could've been a little funnier, but it was still pretty engaging, and when thier is nothing else good on television, then this film is pretty good to watch when you are bored.

"sticking to the source material, andd casting a new, sweet and upcomign lead, helps Rocky and Bullwinkle overcome it's predictablity, the fact that is unfunny for most of the film, and that it seriously needed some better editing."

although rocky and bullwinkle is probably one of the greatest cartoons ever made, they did not need a movie if this is what they where going to make. it stayed true to the cartoon but it being a live action with the cartoon humor it just felt like a really extended episode of the show just with more language, violence and real actors.

This film has no outstanding characters, noir does it have outstanding action. This film is rather bland, created to make some money. This film has very little seriousness, with the comedy being the low point of the film. An extremely generic mind-numbingly painful film.

Doesn't take itself too seriously - perhaps to it's detriment. Really quite fun. Young kids love it and it is purposely crappy in places in a way that delights. Pity about the box office, as it deserves more. Harmless, inoffensive fun.
This could of been a classic if they actually made the jokes funny and get rid of the non realistic sight gags.

I even hated this as a kid. It was so poorly made that nothing in me likes it at all, not even the guest star appearances of Whoopie Goldberg or Robert DeNiro could save this crappy film from being crap.

Is this movie genius? Certainly not. Is it a fun little film that pokes fun at itself? Most definitely. I think if you were a fan of the cartoon you'll enjoy the film. A great cast. Robert De Niro playing "Fearless Leader" is worth watching the movie alone and Jason Alexander plays a perfect Boris. Piper Perabo worked well alongside Rocky and Bullwinkle and had an almost "cartoonish" cuteness about her. This movies never going to be considered one of the best movies ever, but it's good for what it is and that's all it should be.
Robert De Niro what are you doing in this piece of crap?
Just abysmal in every way.

I can't believe I revisited this oddball of a movie. I seen this when I was younger in the theater and on video, so it's part of my childhood! Watching it today, I admire it's corny cartoony style,  but it sometimes gets over-the-top goofy making me wonder why I'm watching this movie. I enjoyed it a little cause it was very hilarious for it's incredible stupidity and craziness, and it's unlike anything out there (that can be a good or a bad thing!).
I thought it was laugh-out-loud enjoyable for it's stupidity! I thought it was well made as what it was made for! It did something new, and I admire that!
I did not like this that much as alot, but there's something about it that's...good.
Cartoons aren't cool when they aren't cartoons.
First movie I ever saw in a theater and it's really not that great a movie but fun to watch and great for kids to enjoy. Even though adults will more than likely get really annoyed by it.

I know a lot of people will disagree with me on this maybe even bash me for this, but if I give this anything lower then this I'd be lying. The film was witty and stayed true to shows style, I thought it worked because it didn't feel like other live action  adaptations of classic cartoons (The Flinstones,Scooby doo, etc.) It actually lived up to the shows spirit rather then just take the show and not even have a similar feel to what you saw there. The puns though corny were funny much like the show and it did well on bringing the characters to life. The only thing I did hate though was how Rocky and Bullwinkle looked like in their live action forms,couldn't they have just made them 2d similar to Roger Rabbit?
The critics were WAY too harsh on this one. I LOVED IT

Maybe I'd rather see Dave Coulier doing his Bullwinkle routine than this again. Rocky and Bullwinkle aren't terrible and I like the original cartoons but this movie is a mess. The only thing that works is DeNiro and he is borderlining badness.
I'll always remember this as a very bad movie.
The Adventures of Rocky and Bullwinkle is a horrible attempt at a remake and doesn't stay true to the original cartoon very well.
I REALLY LIKE ROCKY AND BULLWINKLE BUT THIS MOVIE WAS TOO HARD TO TOLERATE
Worth a watch for one reason only.  To see the worst Travis Bickle, "You talking to me", impression ever done and it's done by none other than Robert DeNiro.

Eh. I remember watching this movie when it first came out and being mildly disappointed for some reason. I re-saw it again recently (I was really bored), and I think I know why this was the case. It is too silly for adults to enjoy and a few too many inside jokes that go over the heads of the kids that it is made for. I know this was a big part of the TV program (which admittedly I was never a big fan of) and it has worked in other movie adaptations of the creator Jay Ward's shows, but this time it just fell flat. It is a little hard to call it a terrible movie because it has some vaguely amusing parts in it and the producers are aware of how corny the material is, but it is still definitely not a good one. If you are ten years or younger or you are a fan of the original cartoon, see it at your own risk. Otherwise, avoid it.

P.S. I am writing this because I found out that today (from what I have read) is the 50th anniversary of the debut of the cartoon, and I am trying to avoid doing work. If you are offended by me writing a negative review of the movie adaptation on the jubilee of the original source, I meant no disrespect; I'm just trying to be honest...and to procrastinate.

Okay, so your sitting at home and nothing is on television, you've watched everything on your DVD, VHS, LaserDisc collection several times, than this film comes on TV; what do you do? Watch it, regardless of how bad it is. 
I saw this in the theaters and felt extremely cheated of my $8. This film was just awful, so awful in fact that within the film the characters are sent to court for being so lousy. 
The whole thing that gets me to watch this film, is the nostalgia, that this film represents. It's Rocky & Bullwinkle, 2 cartoon characters that were as present in my childhood as He-Man & Thundercats were. 
Piper Perabo helps the film a little bitm because she is so amazibgly gorgeous. She also does a decent job at portraying the outsider, she's basically put in the film as an audience member, which helps to relate within all the craziness. 
The most surprising casting done in this film and probably one of the draws for today's generation are; Jason Alexander, Rene Russo and Robert De Niro as the 3 main villains. Having these great actors in this film can only help keep the films head above water. 
De Niro is ridiculous in the role of Fearless Leader, but that is how the character is meant to be. 
Alexander and Russo help as the major comedy element in this film. Both actors have lent themselves to serious and comedy roles before and never have they been so hilarious, but not always in a good way. 
Cameos include David Allen Grier, Joe Polito, Randy Quaid, Whoopi Goldberg, Keenan & Kel and more. 
Go see this film, you have nothing else to watch, lol 
3 out of 5 stars, just for the fact that even the film knows how bad the film is.

A train wreck that is almost fun to watch because it is so incredibly bad. The entire cast and crew must have lost their minds to hallucinogens during the filming. I have no idea why anyone would try to adapt such a campy and cartoony show. It would be like trying to do a live action version of Gumby.
A fun movie with some wit thrown in, but honestly a bit underwhelming.
Didn't do the cartoon justice. At all.

One has to question the making of this film. The film's plot is so flimsical and corny it surpasses the worst expectations. I understand it's a childrens film but this film is less than Mediocre at best.
Nothing Spectacular, but still mildly amusing for fans of the old animated series.
always keep the inner child in you alive... it sometimes keeps you insane...

Miren nom sera el mejor film del mundo ni una majistral bella de arte cinematografico pero es de mi agrado el filma para una buena tarde en familia

En detalles la actucion de DeNiro es buena esa es la verdad da comicidad necesaria para un buen film apesar de que el guion no fue comico como se hubiera deseado.

Lo que si me alegro es la forma en la que se uso la animcion para la interaccion de ewstos clasicos de la animacion

Anyone who says that this "stays true to the original cartoon" was not alive in the 60's and has never seen the original show, never.

The only thing that remains are the names and that Rocky and Bullwinkle are cartoons.  Other than that this has none of the puns, wit, humor, or satire from the original.  This, other than the animation and live-action interaction has no redeeming quality, well the endlessly cute Piper Perabo counts, in the year of Piper Perabo, but all the big name stars who signed on to do this, in a wave of nostalgia, I am sure regretted it after day 1 on the set.

By all means bypass this boring, half-hearted, flop of a movie.......get the box sets of the original instead.
NEITHER BAD, NOR A CLASSIC, BUT AVERAGE
I first saw this movie when I was 6 and when I recently got it on DVD, I loved it!

Rocky and Bullwinkle is a bad film, nothing else I can say will change that. The acting is way too strong, the CGI looks awful and the story is boring and confusing. It is a real shame, because although I had never been a Rocky and Bullwinkle fan as a child, it could have been a possible reimagining to a nostalgic duo.

It's much better than what a lot of people give it credit for. I once again agree with Roger Ebert's review. This movie is fun to watch. Don't take it seriously. Just watch it for the entertainment.

i liked it in the fact that it was still a fun, silly movie. but they could never capture the persona of the old cartoon. as one who watched the cartoon constantly as a young girl, i was a little disappointed after watching the movie, but happy that they added an effort to recreate the beloved tv characters of rocky and bullwinkle. i will always be upset that the show was cancelled.

To me this is just what Rocky and Bullwinkle should be.  Its corny, its campy, its over the top and low key all at once.  I have seen many an episode in my day, and this works like its part of the show.  People act like it tarnished the original, but really it just pays homage to it.

http://cineptimoarte.blogspot.mx/

The Adventures of Rocky Bullwinkle brings those two beloved characters (along with their 3 nemesis') to the real live-action world...well, sorta. Robert De Niro (as Fearless Leader), Jason Alexander (as Boris), and Rene Russo (as Natasha; hot) come to our world to turn everyone into zombies, so FBI Agent Karen Sympathy brings the two title characters to stop them by embarking on a wacky road trip to their evil lair in New York City. With a gigantic cast such as this, you would think this film would have been big (or awesome for that matter), but no. Instead, it's very annoying and very stupid. Robert De Niro should be ashamed for re-stating his infamous monologue from Taxi Driver in a supposedly comical moment. The film started out great when it was an actual cartoon and should have stayed that way. Ultimately, this was embarrassing to watch. I recommend this to either very young children (under 10) or mentally retarded folk.

This is a delightful movie! The stars (DeNiro, etc.) participating in this fun filled romp look like they're having a lot of fun. Their overacting is hilarious. In her debut starring role, Piper Perabo is wonderful as well. She's sweet and perfect for the part. The plot is weak, but that's inconsequential to enjoying this movie. If you are already familiar with the tv series, the dialogue and references of this version seem lacking by comparison. Its not as hip or sharp, but you still won't be diasppointed. I recommend this to baby boomers and newcomers as well.
The comedy in here was lame. I think everyone here was miscasted.

I disagree with the synopsis. I thought DeNiro, Alexander and Russo were fine in their roles. I thought they were definitely gooft enough to stand beside the moose & flying squirrel. This was an okay at best adaptation of the hit cartoon that I loved as a kid.... definitely underachieving for such a good cast.

Very, very, very poor. I though this might be fun to watch with my kids on a rainy Saturday afternoon - how wrong could I be! Maybe living in the UK and not growing up watching R&B was partly to blame but you shouldn't have had to of seen the original cartoon to find it funny. The jokes are really bad and even though many are "supposed" to be bad it just leaves you with an empty felling in your gut. If you want to see a better cartoon to live action film try Scooby Doo instead. My young boys said they liked it but I could tell they were completely lost at some points. I should have done the washing up instead :-(
Smacks of 'trying too hard' - this is one film update of a classic TV show too far. De Niro prooves that even a great actor can turn in a performance of sheer garbage.
GREAT film, I don't care what you all say.

Live action films with animated characters flat don't work, period. The plot of the film does extremely little with the subject material that it has, instead relying on a canned plot, stereotyped villains, and a lead character that's just not that fun to watch. Rocky and Bullwinkle have their zingers and moments throughout, but for some odd reason are not the focus of the film that carries their namesake. And how this film cost $70 million plus is beyond me.
fun and silly movie.....feel like a kid to watch this....

This movie was hit and miss with me. I remember liking parts, but other parts made me not so happy I was sitting in a theater watching the movie. Bullwinkle didn't get nearly enough vocal, humor, and solid time as many of the other characters, and that was too bad since he is always, and was, the funniest and best in the entire movie.

Piper Perabo is the only reason to degrade this movie, and you probably should, at least a little bit for her awful performance. Still the concept is charming, the jokes range between hilariously satirical and as amazingly corney as the telivision show. Yes its campy but if you're a fan of the amazing 60's cartoon show, you know that is not only par for the course but its what Rocky and Bullwinkle were always about. The stars in leads and the star cameos just add an amazing icing on the cake, especially DeNiro. If you didn't enjoy this film, just a little bit, you may have never smiled in your life.
it is a wonderful movie. I enjoyed it very much.

With an all-star cast like that, someone owed someone else a favor, that's all I'm saying.

I think this films is a little underrated.  It's cheesy, but it's much more genuine than most hollywood films, plus I actually think it's fairly funny and truer to the spirit of the series than most people give it credit for.
